Original_notes: ashes made by burning turf – scattered on fields
there is, however, a village leader in charge of co-ordinating co-operative projects
15 to 60 huts in a kokwet (village: several hamlets)
(involving journeys at least 3 days one-way); trade important
an authorized agent of the society [underlined]
only one of the 7 age-sets is allowed to take part in fighting
(+); "War with the Kisii was less of a sport as each side wished to occupy the other’s territory… The Kisii lived in large walled and dry-moated villages on the hill-tops"
all captives seem to have been either ransomed or adopted

(-); "They do not think of the sun as being God but only as a symbol for god" (Orchardson 1961: 20); "A few say that he is the sun, others that he lives in the sun and exercises control over it; but most put forward the idea that the sun is the form under which human beings perceive the divinity" (Peristiany 1939: 214-215)
